title: ZED ENERGY RUNES: Why They Are Essential
body:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e1CLbAevPqo
Detailed Zed guide utilizing energy runes and 40% CD reduction. Unlocking Zed's full potential. Featuring the quad razor shuriken and shadow juke. Secrets kept are weapons wasted.

replies.body: The main reason this play style has not been utilized is that without energy runes Zed will run out of energy when he uses CD reduction. With energy runes Zed feels no lack of energy. The difference is so significant I cannot play without them. The energy runes provide the same amount of energy at 18 that playing Zed on Dominion would give; this build is extremely effective upon dominion as well. Furthermore, once Zed reaches 40% CD reduction he can throw Razor Shuriken twice per Living Shadow.

this would be fun, but its not a viable build or strategy for ranked play
This is all ranked play footage and I score upwards of 10-20 kills nearly every game with very few deaths. Compared to this the bork build is just bad.
so you don't like the bork build?

I do not. The bork build originated from the need for Zed to be able to apply damage after using Death Mark given that most champions could often just walk away from Zed due to either having faster movement speed or a juking ability. Moreover, some felt it was required to ensure a kill after Death Mark and have established builds based around rotating activates. Both of these points are satisfied completely by giving Zed movement speed, Zed not only can chase down any champion he has no problem securing kills on full hp champions with the use of Death Mark when he lands his Razor Shuriken. Furthermore, I prefer the Ravenous Hydra for the ad scaling, early game sustain which the bork build seems to lack entirely, the split pushing ability, and also it is essentially giving Zed another burst ability on a 10 second CD. When you have 400-500 AD Ravenous Hydra does a lot of damage and allows zed to life steal upwards of 200hp per hit when hitting multiple enemies combined with The Blood Thirster.

I used to run a crit build myself but I found that Death Mark became useless late game given that they always died from the crits before it did damage. It was a good step through the shadows and and one shot them build but was not reliable or safe. Also, it does not synergize well with Zeds naturally bursty abilities but relies on melee auto attacks for meaningful damage. It seems to defy his kits design.
